definition: to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself

sentences.english: We admired him for his total commitment to Indian Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 我們因他爲印度的解放事業所作的無私奉獻而欽佩他。

sentences.english: The remarkable achievements of Chinese economy are admirable.
sentences.chinese: 中國經濟發展成績斐然，令人欽佩。

sentences.english: What are some of the reasons that attract people to respect and admire Dayu?
sentences.chinese: 是什麼原因吸引人們去尊敬和欽佩大禹？

sentences.english: The performance heightened my admiration for the tragedian.
sentences.chinese: 這場演出使我更加欽佩這位演員。

sentences.english: All his followers looked up to him as a wise and courageous man.
sentences.chinese: 他的追隨者都欽佩他智勇雙全。

sentences.english: We would admire both his earnestness and his self-aware irony.
sentences.chinese: 我們由衷地欽佩他的認真和有自知之明的諷刺藝術。

sentences.english: Stay-at-home moms deserve our respect and admiration for the difficult course they've chosen and sacrifices they make.
sentences.chinese: 全職媽媽做出的犧牲值得我們欽佩，尊敬。

sentences.english: It’s easy to admire his aspiration, but his hopes were all dashed.
sentences.chinese: 他的抱負很容易得到欽佩，但他的希望全部落空了。

sentences.english: His breadth of knowledge filled me with admiration.
sentences.chinese: 他學識淵博，令我非常欽佩。

sentences.english: I think he conducted himself admirably, considering the difficult circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 考慮到那種困難環境，我認爲他表現得令人欽佩。

sentences.english: He admires his father but also resents him.
sentences.chinese: 他欽佩他的父親，但也討厭他。

sentences.english: We all admire their persistant efforts.
sentences.chinese: 我們都很欽佩他們堅持不懈的努力。

sentences.english: A moneybags is admired very much, fete entertains him.
sentences.chinese: 一個富翁很欽佩，便設宴招待他。

sentences.english: I really admire his capacity for work.
sentences.chinese: 我真欽佩他的工作能力。
貝頓是個令人欽佩的人物。

sentences.english: To Kiyota and thousands like him, Emperor Akihito expressed his admiration.
sentences.chinese: 爲了清田和他一樣數千明仁天皇對此表示欽佩。

definition: to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to be deeply concerned/to be troubled (by)
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to be dedicated to one's work/to respect one's work
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
